snippet: A district judge outlined the punishment Monday for Dianna Duran, a former New Mexico secretary of state, in a campaign finance scandal.
abstract: Judge T Glenn Ellington sentences former New Mexico secretary of state Dianna Duran to 30 days in jail for campaign finance theft and orders her to hand-deliver letters of apology to political donors, write another letter to residents of New Mexico and perform thousands of hours of community service.
lead_paragraph: A district judge outlined the punishment Monday for Dianna Duran, a former New Mexico secretary of state, in a campaign finance scandal.

headline.main: New Mexico: Politician Must Write Letters
headline.print_headline: New Mexico: Politician Must Write Letters
